title: 103_s1691
content: Credit for property used in agriculture-related activities for environmental pollution control and soil and water conservation expenditures. The amendment introduces the agricultural environmental credit for eligible taxpayers, providing a tax credit for environmental pollution control and soil and water conservation expenditures in agriculture-related activities. The agricultural environmental credit allows taxpayers to claim 15% of certain agricultural property placed in service or deductions under section 175, up to $15,000 or $150,000 minus previous credits claimed. The agricultural environmental credit allows eligible taxpayers primarily engaged in a farming-related business to claim 15% of certain agricultural property placed in service or deductions under section 175, up to $15,000 or $150,000 minus previous credits claimed. Eligible taxpayers include those involved in farming businesses, mixing fertilizers, and wholesale distribution of agricultural products. The agricultural environmental credit allows eligible taxpayers primarily engaged in farming to claim 15% of certain agricultural property used for environmental compliance, such as treatment facilities for pollution control. The term 'new identifiable treatment facility' refers to a facility that does not significantly increase output, extend the useful life, or reduce operating costs of a plant, and does not alter the nature of any manufacturing process. The subsection provides special rules for coordination with energy and rehabilitation credits, deduction for soil and water conservation expenditures, and amortization of pollution. This subsection does not apply to property if an election is made under section 169 regarding the basis of the property. Clerical amendments are made to the section heading for section 48 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to periods after December 31, 1993, under rules similar to the rules of section 48(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
